listitem.para:
IKEv2 (RFC4309) settings to be used. Currently the accepted values are never (the default) signifying no IKEv2 negotiation should be transmitted or accepted; permit, signifying no IKEv2 should be transmitted, but will be accepted if the other ends initiates to us with IKEv2; propose, signifying that we permit IKEv2, and also use it as the default to initiate; insist, signifying we only accept and receive IKEv2 - IKEv1 negotiations will be rejected.
If the ikev2= setting is set to permit or propose Openswan will try and detect a "bid down" attack from IKEv2 to IKEv1. Since there is no standard for transmitting the IKEv2 capability with IKEv1, Openswan uses a special Vendor ID "CAN-IKEv2", and will insist on an IKEv2 rekey when it completes an IKEv1 negotiation. If the ikev2= setting is set to insist, no IKEv1 negotiation is allowed, and no bid down attack is possible.
